trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Keller
There were no other sightings in Keller on or around January 14th 2008
divs: sighting detailsit was just about to be 8:00(7:58) pm, and i was driving south on texas 377 just south of keller. i was stopped at a stop light, when i had a clear view up the western sky. the sun had long gone down by now and the stars were visable. as i sat at a stop light, i viewed west and saw what appeared to be a "shooting star", but there was something odd about this. it did remain in sight about as long as a shooting star, about 1 second, but it was really bright; a distinct white streak, as long as it remained in sight. the tracjectory was in a 90 degree angle going from top down. and also, it was unusually close to the ground. which lead me to speculate what it was. if it was a shooting star that was visable, it would have been overhead and fade in color. this was about 2-3 inches from the crest of the earth. if a shooting star was that far away to be that close to the horizon, it would be too far away to actually see. and especially too far away to be that bright and defined. i shrugged this off as a non-event, until the next day when im on the way to work and the radio is talking about a major sighting in stevenville, texas which is 1 1\2 west of keller, and about the same time i saw the "star".
